lines.text: if the world is round, why is a frozen lake flat?

[flipping through book]
Ah, here it says that Lake Ontario curves more than 3 degrees from its Eastern end to its Western end. So frozen water really isn't flat.
This one who's blind. She's the one that can see.

[while passing by a dilapidated church]
The churches belong to God, but he doesn't seem to care about them.
One of the things I love about Venice, is that it's so safe for me to walk.
Thank you... The sound changes, you see, as you come to a canal. And the echoes from the walls are so clear... My sister hates it.
She says it's like a city in aspic, wrapped over from a dinner party, where all the guests are dead or gone.
The skill of police artists is to make the living appear dead.
Christine is dead. She is dead! Dead! Dead! Dead! Dead! Dead!
Your bishop makes me feel strange.
I imagine he makes God feel less than immaculate.
Age makes women grow to look more like each other. Don't you find that? Old men decay and each becomes quite distinct. Women seem to converge, eh?
Fetch him back! Let him not go!
